purpose: The email announces a postdoctoral position available in programming languages, specifically focused on fixed-point-oriented programming. The sender, an assistant professor at NUS, encourages recipients to share the opportunity with interested candidates. The position involves developing programs based on inference rules that simplify complex algorithms in various domains. The application process is outlined, emphasizing the urgency to fill the role quickly, with interviews starting immediately. Additional details about the project and the sender's research interests are provided, along with links for further information.

evidence_sentences: I am excited to announce the following postdoctoral position.
Please share this post (available at https://michaeldadams.org/hiring) with anyone who you think might be interested.
We are excited to announce a postdoctoral position in programming languages focused on the newly emerging paradigm of fixed-point-oriented programming.
If you or someone you know is interested in this position, please email me at 'adamsmd AT nus.edu.sg' to schedule a Zoom interview.
We are eager to fill this role quickly, so interviews will begin immediately.
The position offers a competitive salary and a flexible start date, with funding available for 2 to 3 years, contingent upon satisfactory progress.
Our team is developing a language and implementation that transforms high-level specifications into optimized Haskell modules.
For more in-depth information, please refer to our lab's white paper: https://michaeldadams.org/papers/fpop/fixed-point-oriented-programming.pdf
My research is dedicated to empowering programmers to write clear, concise, and elegant code without compromising performance.
